title: 19 best denim jackets for women in 2023 , plus pro shopping tips
body_text:
Denim jackets are a transitional piece that can't miss in your wardrobe. They stand the test of time and are a reliable layer when the temperature drops slightly and you need a lighter option. Aside from their continuous timeless aesthetic, denim jackets are a practical way of elevating any look.
They add warmth, texture and formality to most basic pieces. To get a better understanding, we talked to experts to find the right fit formula for this wardrobe staple.
With so many different iterations, styles and washes, you can't go wrong with the classic denim route and embrace the look that has been around for over 100 years.
Why are denim jackets a wardrobe staple?
There's simply something about the silhouette and the style that make denim jackets something we constantly reach for, says celebrity and personal stylist Basia Richard, adding that it's why almost everyone has one (or multiple!) in their closet.
"No matter what the trends are, it’s just something that we can wear no matter what," she adds.
The overall versatility of the jacket make them easy to grab in a pinch, even when looking to transform an outfit.
"It’s a very classic silhouette that we can really wear with sort of anything," Richard explains. "It goes with those clothes and looks that are a little bit dressier; that [denim] jacket is going to turn them into more casual looks."
If you don't own this wardrobe essential already — or if you're wanting to add more denim jackets to your collection — we found top-rated picks below that can easily become your year-round staples. Keep scrolling or use the links below to learn more.
What to look for | Finding the right fit | Editor-approved picks | More denim jackets | How we chose | Meet our experts
What to look for when shopping for a denim jacket?
Richard notes that there are a few key factors shoppers should keep in mind when searching for the right denim jacket:
Function. "It really depends on the function and where you’re going to wear it," Richard says. Are you going to be dressing up a casual summer outfit? Or throwing it over your shoulder to layer over an airport outfit?
Style. Are you going for a more light-washed look? Or are you looking to darken the hues of your closet with a dark-washed jacket? Do you prefer oversized or fitted? What kind of collar, sleeves or silhouette are you looking for? These are all questions Richard recommends keeping in mind.
Body type and fit. Richard also suggests evaluating your body type and how a denim jacket might feel, fit and look. "[Keep] in mind the styles overall just to make sure we don’t blindly follow the trends. ... When you pick the jacket, [make sure] it’s actually going to fit your silhouette," she says. Richard adds that those with wider hips might opt for a shorter jacket that will help accentuate their silhouette. On the other hand, those who like "boyish" oversized tees might instead go for oversized jackets that will provide a similar style and structure.
Durability. Finally, while it's difficult to determine the quality of a jacket while online shopping or viewing it on the hanger in a store, Richard says that finding one that has longevity means you won't ruin it after a wash, nor will you have to buy a new one often.
How to find the right fit for denim jackets
Finding the right fit depends on personal preference. According to SVP of denim design at Madewell Mary Pierson, the perfect fit is not “too long, short or oversized.”
In terms of colors and washes, “I like to opt for a medium to light wash as it pairs well with a wide range of outfits. Then depending on current trends, you might also find oversized or cropped versions available. I recommend looking for ones with classic details like double-needle stitching, metal shank buttons, and flap front pockets,” adds Pierson.
Also, a classic fit "serves as a timeless staple, offering a balanced silhouette that’s neither too loose nor too tight."
If you prefer something more oversized, she recommends thinking about your look options. "Consider how you’d like to style it—whether you prefer a traditional, fitted look or are interested in experimenting with oversized or cropped styles to suit your style and latest trends," says Pierson.

SEO writer Jannely Espinal loves this classic design for its functional features. "It comes with inner and outer pockets plus I can style it with dresses, jeans and jumpsuits. I personalized mine with patches but I love how efficient this jacket is and I've had it already for four years. It hasn't disappointed," she says.
Wrangler Girlfriend Denim Jacket
- Can wear a hoodie underneath
- Not the most lightweight
Colors: Four | Fit: Relaxed | Length: Below waist | Pockets: Four | Fabric: 99% cotton, 1% elastane | Sizes: XS-XXL | Care: Machine-wash
A classic fit is all you need to keep it chic and comfortable. Associate editor Kamari Stewart loves this one and she says, "I always get compliments on it. I got my normal size but it’s oversized enough that I can still wear a hoodie underneath. It has a little weight to it so in the spring, I wear it alone but I can also wear it in the fall."
J. Crew New Classic Denim Jacket
- True to size
- Gets softer over time
- Sleeves are long-arm friendly
- Wash by itself for first wash
Colors: Two | Fit: True to size | Length: Cropped | Pockets: Four | Fabric: 100% cotton | Sizes: XXXS-3X | Care: Machine-wash
"I can attest to the longevity I’ve had with my current J. Crew denim jacket," says senior editor Jess Bender. "I purchased mine about five years ago, and it looks as good as it did the day I took it out of its packaging. The style itself is timeless and the lighter denim color coordinates well with most of my casual looks whenever I need a top (and a few of my evening ‘fits if I want to give them an edgier touch)."
Tommy Bahama Chambray O'lei Jacket
- Flexible fit
- Lightweight feel
- Can run short
Colors: One | Fit: Relaxed | Length: Below waist | Pockets: Four | Fabric: 100% Tencel Lyocell | Sizes: XXS-XXL | Care: Machine-wash

"It has stretch and softness to it while still holding its shape which I’ve noticed is hard to find. It never feels like you’re wearing a heavy denim jacket but it is still comfortable for cooler nights," she adds, While her denim jacket of choice is almost out of stock, the chambray iteration is not too dark or too light and a great transitional piece for cool weather.

And for an even edgier style, this H&M piece will take your jean jacket game to the next level. According to the brand, it has a velvet-like finish that creates a unique shade of black. We think this would look great paired with jean pants or even over a sweater dress and boots.
Frequently Asked Questions
Denim jackets tend to use "thicker, non-stretch denim," according to Richard.
"You can add a little bit of stretch to it, so it’s going to be a little more fitted, but their denim is really thick, well-structured. It will hold the shape. If you wash it, the denim is always going to hold the shape. That’s just a very trendy thing. It’s very classic," she explains, citing Levi's denim jackets as an example.
According to Richard, leather jackets require more "specific" styling.
"It does fit into more of the rocker chic style, but denim is, again, so much more versatile. It’s a little bit more casual, it’s not as heavy as leather. Leather jackets can be very warm and heavy," she explains.
Again, unlike denim skirts (which are rising again in popularity as of late) and tried-and-true denim jeans , it all comes down to how flexible you can be when styling a denim jacket, explains Richard.
"[Denim skirts have] one of those silhouettes that [are] more difficult. ... I hear from women, 'I don’t want to wear jeans because it’s ... very casual, everyone wears jeans; I want to dress it up,'" she says. Denim jackets, on the other hand, can function in a wider set of scenarios. "You can wear it in the winter; you can wear it in the summer," Richard adds.
When it comes to denim, "there are no rules to it," regardless of season, Richard says. "It is a layering piece, but you can throw it just on top of the shoulders. Think of it as an accessory, almost," she adds.
How we chose
We selected the most popular styles based on the expert's recommendations and asked our editors for their tried-and-truth pieces. Also, we scoured through reviews and chose denim jackets based on sizing availability and shoppers' favorites.
Meet the experts
- Basia Richard is a freelance stylist who specializes in helping clients find professional clothing that fits their personal style and can be worn at the office. She has also styled multiple celebrities.
Mary Pierson is the SVP of denim design at Madewell.
